Joint Statement from the Secretary and Undersecretary on Kodian Frontier Service and Rangers Expansion:

In light of the recent discovery of a protosapient species in the Kodia system, we are announcing a significant increase in funding and an expansion of the mandate for both the Kodian Frontier Service and the Kodian Frontier Rangers. This decision reflects our commitment to the responsible exploration and development of the Kodia system, while also ensuring the protection and preservation of its unique environments and indigenous life forms.

The expanded mandate for the Kodian Frontier Service will include further research and analysis of the protosapient species, as well as increased support for scientific studies to better understand their habitat, behaviors, and potential for future interaction with human settlers. This expanded role will facilitate the development of policies and guidelines to minimize any adverse impacts on these remarkable beings and their ecosystems.

The Kodian Frontier Rangers will also see a significant expansion in their responsibilities and capabilities. Their mission will now include the protection and conservation of the protosapient species and their habitats, as well as the promotion of responsible interactions between human settlers and the native life forms. Enhanced training and resources will be provided to ensure that the Rangers are fully equipped to carry out their vital mission, and to meet the challenges and opportunities presented by this extraordinary discovery.

We firmly believe that the expansion of the Kodian Frontier Service and Rangers' roles is essential to the responsible stewardship of the Kodia system and its unique life forms. With this increased support, we can ensure a sustainable and harmonious future for all who call the Kodia system home, and continue our exploration of the cosmos with respect and care for the remarkable diversity of life that it contains.
